Achievements.NO_HOBO_Description: Build a house suitable enough for your first town NPC, such as the guide, to move into.
Achievements.OBTAIN_HAMMER_Description: Obtain your first hammer via crafting or otherwise.
Achievements.OOO_SHINY_Description: Mine your first nugget of ore with a pickaxe.
Achievements.HEART_BREAKER_Description: Discover and smash your first heart crystal underground.
Achievements.HEAVY_METAL_Description: Obtain an anvil made from iron or lead.
Achievements.I_AM_LOOT_Description: Discover a golden chest underground and take a peek at its contents.
Achievements.STAR_POWER_Description: Craft a mana crystal out of fallen stars, and consume it.
Achievements.EYE_ON_YOU_Description: Defeat the Eye of Cthulhu, an ocular menace who only appears at night.
Achievements.SMASHING_POPPET_Description: Using explosives or your trusty hammer, smash a Shadow Orb or Crimson Heart in the evil parts of your world.
Achievements.WORM_FODDER_Description: Defeat the Eater of Worlds, a massive worm who dwells in the corruption.
Achievements.MASTERMIND_Description: Defeat the Brain of Cthulhu, an enormous demon brain which haunts the creeping crimson.
Achievements.WHERES_MY_HONEY_Description: Discover a large bee's hive deep in the jungle.
Achievements.STING_OPERATION_Description: Defeat the Queen Bee, the matriarch of the jungle hives.
Achievements.BONED_Description: Defeat Skeletron, the cursed guardian of the dungeon.
Achievements.DUNGEON_HEIST_Description: Steal a key from the dungeon's undead denizens, and unlock one of their precious golden chests.
Achievements.ITS_GETTING_HOT_IN_HERE_Description: Spelunk deep enough to reach the molten underworld.
Achievements.MINER_FOR_FIRE_Description: Craft a molten pickaxe using the hottest of materials.
Achievements.STILL_HUNGRY_Description: Defeat the Wall of Flesh, the master and core of the world who arises after a great, burning sacrifice.
Achievements.ITS_HARD_Description: Unleash the ancient spirits of light and darkness across your world, enabling much stronger foes and showering the world with dazzling treasures (and rainbows!).
Achievements.BEGONE_EVIL_Description: Smash a demon or crimson altar with a powerful, holy hammer.
Achievements.EXTRA_SHINY_Description: Mine a powerful ore that has been newly blessed upon your world.
Achievements.BUCKETS_OF_BOLTS_Description: Defeat the three nocturnal mechanical menaces: the Twins, the Destroyer, and Skeletron Prime.
Achievements.DRAX_ATTAX_Description: Craft a drax or pickaxe axe using hallowed bars, and the souls of the three mechanical bosses.
Achievements.PHOTOSYNTHESIS_Description: Mine chlorophyte, an organic ore found deep among the thickest of flora.
Achievements.GET_A_LIFE_Description: Consume a life fruit, which grows in the thick of subterranean jungle grass.
Achievements.THE_GREAT_SOUTHERN_PLANTKILL_Description: Defeat Plantera, the overgrown monstrosity of the jungle's depths.
Achievements.TEMPLE_RAIDER_Description: Breach the impenetrable walls of the jungle temple.
Achievements.LIHZAHRDIAN_IDOL_Description: Defeat Golem, the stone-faced ritualistic idol of the lihzahrd tribe.
Achievements.ROBBING_THE_GRAVE_Description: Obtain a rare treasure from a difficult monster in the dungeon.
Achievements.BIG_BOOTY_Description: Unlock one of the dungeon's large, mysterious chests with a special key.
Achievements.FISH_OUT_OF_WATER_Description: Defeat Duke Fishron, mutant terror of the sea.
Achievements.OBSESSIVE_DEVOTION_Description: Defeat the Ancient Cultist, fanatical leader of the dungeon coven.
Achievements.STAR_DESTROYER_Description: Defeat the four celestial towers of the moon.
Achievements.BLOODBATH_Description: Survive a blood moon, a nocturnal event where the rivers run red and monsters swarm aplenty.
Achievements.SLIPPERY_SHINOBI_Description: Defeat King Slime, the lord of all things slimy.
Achievements.GOBLIN_PUNTER_Description: Triumph over a goblin invasion, a ragtag regiment of crude, barbaric, pointy-eared warriors and their shadowflame sorcerers.
Achievements.WALK_THE_PLANK_Description: Triumph over a pirate invasion, a group of pillagers from the sea out for your booty... and your life!
Achievements.KILL_THE_SUN_Description: Survive a solar eclipse, a day darker than night filled with creatures of horror.
Achievements.DO_YOU_WANT_TO_SLAY_A_SNOWMAN_Name: Do You Want to Slay a Snowman?
Achievements.DO_YOU_WANT_TO_SLAY_A_SNOWMAN_Descriptio: Triumph over the frost legion, a festive family of maniacal snowman mobsters.
Achievements.TIN_FOIL_HATTER_Description: Triumph over a martian invasion, when beings from out of this world come to scramble your brains and probe you in uncomfortable places.
Achievements.BALEFUL_HARVEST_Description: Reach the 15th wave of a pumpkin moon, where evil lurks among the autumn harvest.
Achievements.ICE_SCREAM_Description: Reach the 15th wave of a frost moon, where the festive season quickly degrades into madness.
Achievements.STICKY_SITUATION_Description: Survive the slime rain, where gelatinous organisms fall from the sky in droves.
Achievements.REAL_ESTATE_AGENT_Description: Have all possible town NPCs living in your world.
Achievements.NOT_THE_BEES_Description: Fire a Bee Gun while wearing a full set of Bee Armor.
Achievements.JEEPERS_CREEPERS_Description: Stumble into a spider cavern in the underground.
Achievements.FUNKYTOWN_Description: Build or encounter a glowing mushroom field above the surface.
Achievements.INTO_ORBIT_Description: You can only go down from here!
Achievements.MECHA_MAYHEM_Description: Do battle against the Twins, the Destroyer, and Skeletron Prime simultaneously and emerge victorious.
Achievements.GELATIN_WORLD_TOUR_Description: Defeat every type of slime there is!
Achievements.FASHION_STATEMENT_Description: Equip armor or vanity clothing in all three social slots.
Achievements.VEHICULAR_MANSLAUGHTER_Description: Defeat an enemy by running it over with a minecart.
Achievements.THERE_ARE_SOME_WHO_CALL_HIM_Name: There are Some Who Call Him...
Achievements.SWORD_OF_THE_HERO_Description: Obtain a Terra Blade, forged from the finest blades of light and darkness.
Achievements.LUCKY_BREAK_Description: Survive a long fall with just a sliver of health remaining.
Achievements.DYE_HARD_Description: Equip a dye in every possible dye slot.
Achievements.FREQUENT_FLYER_Description: Spend over 1 gold being treated by the nurse.
Achievements.RAINBOWS_AND_UNICORNS_Description: Fire a rainbow gun while riding on a unicorn.
Achievements.IT_CAN_TALK_Description: Build a house in a mushroom biome and have the Truffle move in.
Achievements.WATCH_YOUR_STEP_Description: Become a victim to a nasty underground trap.
Achievements.MARATHON_MEDALIST_Description: Travel a total of 26.2 miles on foot.
Achievements.SERVANT_IN_TRAINING_Description: Complete your 1st quest for the angler.
Achievements.GOOD_LITTLE_SLAVE_Description: Complete your 10th quest for the angler.
Achievements.TROUT_MONKEY_Description: Complete your 25th quest for the angler.
Achievements.FAST_AND_FISHIOUS_Description: Complete your 50th quest for the angler.
Achievements.SUPREME_HELPER_MINION_Description: Complete a grand total of 200 quests for the angler.
Achievements.TOPPED_OFF_Description: Attain maximum life and mana possible without accessories or buffs.
Achievements.YOU_CAN_DO_IT_Description: Survive your character's first full night.
Achievements.MATCHING_ATTIRE_Description: Equip armor in all three armor slots: head, chest, and feet.
Achievements.BEHIND_THE_MASK_Description: Slay the Insane Cultist, a mad magician with powerful spells.
Achievements.DAVY_JONES_LOCKER_Description: Defeat the Flying Dutchman, the sails of the plunderin' skies.
Achievements.WINTERHEARTED_Description: Defeat the Ice Queen, wicked witch of the coldest nights.
Achievements.PUMPKIN_SMASHER_Description: Defeat the Pumpking, the spooky lord of hallow's eve.
Achievements.INDEPENDENCE_DAY_Description: Defeat a Mothership, overminds of the martian invaders.
Achievements.HEX_EDUCATION_Description: Defeat a Goblin Summoner, conjurers of the darkest flames.
Achievements.DEFEAT_EMPRESS_OF_LIGHT_Description: Defeat the Empress of Light, responsible for all those flashy lights and glitter.
Achievements.DEFEAT_QUEEN_SLIME_Description: Defeat Queen Slime, giving the coup-de-grace to the sovereign of all that jiggles.
Achievements.DEFEAT_DREADNAUTILUS_Description: Defeat the Dreadnautilus, murderous mollusk lurking beneath the surface of the sanguine seas.
Achievements.DEFEAT_OLD_ONES_ARMY_TIER3_Description: Repel the strongest forces the Old One's Army can muster.
Achievements.GET_ZENITH_Description: Obtain the Zenith, the culmination of a journey forged into the ultimate sword.
Achievements.GET_TERRASPARK_BOOTS_Description: Obtain the Terraspark Boots, forged from the finest boots of fire and ice.
Achievements.FLY_A_KITE_ON_A_WINDY_DAY_Description: Fly a kite on a windy day.
Achievements.FOUND_GRAVEYARD_Description: Enter a misty graveyard filled with the surly dead.
Achievements.GO_LAVA_FISHING_Description: Drop a lure in a pool of lava for a pre-fried haul!
Achievements.TURN_GNOME_TO_STATUE_Description: Trick a gnome into turning into stone!
Achievements.TALK_TO_NPC_AT_MAX_HAPPINESS_Description: Meet with a tenant who's as happy as they possibly can be!
Achievements.PET_THE_PET_Description: Deliver headpats to the town pet.
Achievements.THROW_A_PARTY_Description: What you're celebrating doesn't matter, just throw a party already!
Achievements.DIE_TO_DEAD_MANS_CHEST_Description: You were so preoccupied with whether or not you could open the chest that you didn't stop to think if you should.

LegacyWorldGen.74: Slime is falling from the sky!
LegacyWorldGen.75: Slime has stopped falling from the sky.

LegacyDialog.1: I hope a scrawny kid like you isn't all that is standing between us and Cthulhu's Eye.
LegacyDialog.10: Check out my dirt blocks; they are extra dirty.
LegacyDialog.100: Why purify the world when you can just blow it up?
LegacyDialog.101: If you throw this one in the bathtub and close all the windows, it'll clear your sinuses and pop your ears!
LegacyDialog.103: Hey, could you sign this Griefing Waiver?
LegacyDialog.105: Explosives are da' bomb these days.  Buy some now!
LegacyDialog.106: It's a good day to die!
LegacyDialog.107: I wonder what happens if I... (BOOM!)... Oh, sorry, did you need that leg?
LegacyDialog.108: Dynamite, my own special cure-all for what ails ya.
LegacyDialog.109: Check out my goods; they have explosive prices!
LegacyDialog.11: Boy, that sun is hot! I do have some perfectly ventilated armor.
LegacyDialog.110: I keep having vague memories of tying up a woman and throwing her in a dungeon.
LegacyDialog.111: ... we have a problem! It's a Blood Moon out there!
LegacyDialog.112: T'were I younger, I would ask {Nurse} out. I used to be quite the lady killer.
LegacyDialog.113: That Red Hat of yours looks familiar...
LegacyDialog.114: Thanks again for freeing me from my curse. Felt like something jumped up and bit me.
LegacyDialog.115: Mama always said I would make a great tailor.
LegacyDialog.116: Life's like a box of clothes; you never know what you are gonna wear!
LegacyDialog.117: Of course embroidery is hard! If it wasn't hard, no one would do it! That's what makes it great.
LegacyDialog.118: I know everything they is to know about the clothierin' business.
LegacyDialog.119: Being cursed was lonely, so I once made a friend out of leather. I named him Wilson.
LegacyDialog.12: The sun is high, but my prices are not.
LegacyDialog.120: Thank you for freeing me, human.  I was tied up and left here by the other goblins.  You could say that we didn't get along very well.
LegacyDialog.121: I can't believe they tied me up and left me here just for pointing out that they weren't going east!
LegacyDialog.122: Now that I'm an outcast, can I throw away the spiked balls? My pockets hurt.
LegacyDialog.123: Looking for a gadgets expert? I'm your goblin!
LegacyDialog.124: Thanks for your help. Now, I have to finish pacing around aimlessly here. I'm sure we'll meet again.
LegacyDialog.126: Hey...what's {Mechanic} up to? Have you...have you talked to her, by chance?
LegacyDialog.127: Hey, does your hat need a motor? I think I have a motor that would fit exactly in that hat.
LegacyDialog.128: Yo, I heard you like rockets and running boots, so I put some rockets in your running boots.
LegacyDialog.129: Silence is golden. Duct tape is silver.
LegacyDialog.13: Oh, great. I can hear {Mechanic} and {Nurse} arguing from here.
LegacyDialog.130: YES, gold is stronger than iron. What are they teaching these humans nowadays?
LegacyDialog.131: You know, that mining helmet-flipper combination was a much better idea on paper.
LegacyDialog.132: Goblins are surprisingly easy to anger. In fact, they could start a war over cloth!
LegacyDialog.133: To be honest, most goblins aren't exactly rocket scientists. Well, some are.
LegacyDialog.134: Do you know why we all carry around these spiked balls? Because I don't.
LegacyDialog.135: I just finished my newest creation! This version doesn't explode violently if you breathe on it too hard.
LegacyDialog.136: Goblin thieves aren't very good at their job. They can't even steal from an unlocked chest!
LegacyDialog.137: Thanks for saving me, friend!  This bondage was starting to chafe.
LegacyDialog.139: Oh, how heroic! Thank you for saving me, young lady!
LegacyDialog.14: Have you seen Chith...Shith.. Chat... The big eye?
LegacyDialog.140: Oh, how heroic! Thank you for saving me, young man!
LegacyDialog.141: Now that we know each other, I can move in with you, right?
LegacyDialog.142: Well, hi there, {Guide}! What can I do for you today?
LegacyDialog.143: Well, hi there, {Demolitionist}! What can I do for you today?
LegacyDialog.144: Well, hi there, {GoblinTinkerer}! What can I do for you today?
LegacyDialog.145: Well, hi there, {Nurse}! What can I do for you today?
LegacyDialog.146: Well, hi there, {Mechanic}! What can I do for you today?
LegacyDialog.147: Well, hi there, {Dryad}! What can I do for you today?
LegacyDialog.148: Want me to pull a coin from behind your ear? No? Ok.
LegacyDialog.149: Do you want some magic candy? No? Ok.
LegacyDialog.15: Hey, this house is secure, right? Right? {PlayerName}?
LegacyDialog.150: I make a rather enchanting hot chocolate if you'd be inter...No? Ok.
LegacyDialog.151: Are you here for a peek at my crystal ball?
LegacyDialog.152: Ever wanted an enchanted ring that turns rocks into slimes? Well neither did I.
LegacyDialog.153: Someone once told me friendship is magic. That's ridiculous. You can't turn people into frogs with friendship.
LegacyDialog.154: I can see your future now... You will buy a lot of items from me!
LegacyDialog.155: I once tried to bring an Angel Statue to life. It didn't do anything.
LegacyDialog.156: Thanks!  It was just a matter of time before I ended up like the rest of the skeletons down here.
LegacyDialog.157: Hey, watch where you're going! I was over there a little while ago!
LegacyDialog.158: Hold on, I've almost got wifi going down here.
LegacyDialog.159: But I was almost done putting blinking lights up here!
LegacyDialog.16: Not even a Blood Moon can stop capitalism. Let's do some business.
LegacyDialog.160: DON'T MOVE. I DROPPED MY CONTACT.
LegacyDialog.161: All I want is for the switch to make the... What?!
LegacyDialog.162: Oh, let me guess. Didn't buy enough wire. Idiot.
LegacyDialog.163: Just-could you just... Please? Ok? Ok. Ugh.
LegacyDialog.164: I don't appreciate the way you're looking at me. I am WORKING right now.
LegacyDialog.165: Hey, {PlayerName}, did you just come from {GoblinTinkerer}'s? Did he say anything about me by chance?
LegacyDialog.166: {ArmsDealer} keeps talking about pressing my pressure plate. I told him it was for stepping on.
LegacyDialog.167: Always buy more wire than you need!
LegacyDialog.168: Did you make sure your device was plugged in?
LegacyDialog.169: Oh, you know what this house needs? More blinking lights.
LegacyDialog.17: Keep your eye on the prize, buy a lens!
LegacyDialog.170: You can tell a Blood Moon is out when the sky turns red. There is something about it that causes monsters to swarm.
LegacyDialog.171: Hey, buddy, do you know where any deathweed is? Oh, no reason; just wondering, is all.
LegacyDialog.172: If you were to look up, you'd see that the moon is red right now.
LegacyDialog.173: You should stay indoors at night. It is very dangerous to be wandering around in the dark.
LegacyDialog.174: Greetings, {PlayerName}. Is there something I can help you with?
LegacyDialog.175: I am here to give you advice on what to do next.  It is recommended that you talk with me anytime you get stuck.
LegacyDialog.176: They say there is a person who will tell you how to survive in this land... oh wait. That's me.
LegacyDialog.177: You can use your pickaxe to dig through dirt, and your axe to chop down trees. Just place your cursor over the tile and click!
LegacyDialog.178: If you want to survive, you will need to create weapons and shelter. Start by chopping down trees and gathering wood.
LegacyDialog.179: Press {InventoryKey} to access your crafting menu. When you have enough wood, create a workbench. This will allow you to create more complicated things, as long as you are standing close to it.
LegacyDialog.18: Kosh, kapleck Mog. Oh sorry, that's klingon for 'Buy something or die.'
LegacyDialog.180: You can build a shelter by placing wood or other blocks in the world. Don't forget to create and place walls.
LegacyDialog.181: Once you have a wooden sword, you might try to gather some gel from the slimes. Combine wood and gel to make a torch!
LegacyDialog.182: To interact with backgrounds, use a hammer!
LegacyDialog.183: You should do some mining to find metal ore. You can craft very useful things with it.
LegacyDialog.184: Now that you have some ore, you will need to turn it into a bar in order to make items with it. This requires a furnace!
LegacyDialog.185: You can create a furnace out of torches, wood, and stone. Make sure you are standing near a work bench.
LegacyDialog.186: You will need an anvil to make most things out of metal bars.
LegacyDialog.187: Anvils can be crafted out of iron or lead, or purchased from a merchant.
LegacyDialog.188: Underground are crystal hearts which can be used to increase your max life. You can smash them with a pickaxe.
LegacyDialog.189: If you gather 5 fallen stars, they can be combined to create an item that will increase your magic capacity.
LegacyDialog.19: {PlayerName} is it? I've heard good things, friend!
LegacyDialog.190: Stars fall all over the world at night. They can be used for all sorts of useful things. If you see one, be sure to grab it because they disappear after sunrise.
LegacyDialog.191: There are many different ways you can attract people to move in to our town. They will of course need a home to live in.
LegacyDialog.192: In order for a room to be considered a home, it needs to have a door, a chair, a table, and a light source.  Make sure the house has walls as well.
LegacyDialog.193: Two people will not live in the same home. Also, if their home is destroyed, they will look for a new place to live.
LegacyDialog.194: You can use the housing interface to assign and view housing. Open your inventory and click the house icon.
LegacyDialog.195: If you want a merchant to move in, you will need to gather plenty of money. 50 silver coins should do the trick!
LegacyDialog.196: For a nurse to move in, you might want to increase your maximum life.
LegacyDialog.197: If you had a gun, I bet an arms dealer might show up to sell you some ammo!
LegacyDialog.198: You should prove yourself by defeating a strong monster. That will get the attention of a dryad.
LegacyDialog.199: Make sure to explore the dungeon thoroughly. There may be prisoners held deep within.
LegacyDialog.2: Look at that shoddy armor you're wearing. Better buy some more healing potions.
LegacyDialog.20: I hear there's a secret treasure... oh never mind.
LegacyDialog.200: Perhaps the old man by the dungeon would like to join us now that his curse has been lifted.
LegacyDialog.201: Hang on to any bombs you might find. A demolitionist may want to have a look at them.
LegacyDialog.202: Are goblins really so different from us that we couldn't live together peacefully?
LegacyDialog.203: I heard there was a powerful wizard who lives in these parts.  Make sure to keep an eye out for him next time you go underground.
LegacyDialog.204: If you combine lenses at a demon altar, you might be able to find a way to summon a powerful monster. You will want to wait until night before using it, though.
LegacyDialog.205: You can create worm bait with rotten chunks and vile powder. Make sure you are in a corrupt area before using it.
LegacyDialog.206: Demonic altars can usually be found in the corruption. You will need to be near them to craft some items.
LegacyDialog.207: You can make a grappling hook from a hook and 3 chains. Skeletons found deep underground usually carry hooks, and chains can be made from iron bars or lead bars.
LegacyDialog.208: If you see a pot, be sure to smash it open. They contain all sorts of useful supplies.
LegacyDialog.209: There is treasure hidden all over the world. Some amazing things can be found deep underground!
LegacyDialog.21: Angel Statue you say? I'm sorry, I'm not a junk dealer.
LegacyDialog.210: Smashing a shadow orb will sometimes cause a meteor to fall out of the sky. Shadow orbs can usually be found in the chasms around corrupt areas.
LegacyDialog.211: You should focus on gathering more life crystals to increase your maximum life.
LegacyDialog.212: Your current equipment simply won't do. You need to make better armor.
LegacyDialog.213: I think you are ready for your first major battle. Gather some lenses from the eyeballs at night and take them to a demon altar.
LegacyDialog.214: You will want to increase your life before facing your next challenge. Fifteen hearts should be enough.
LegacyDialog.215: The ebonstone in the corruption can be purified using some powder from a dryad, or it can be destroyed with explosives.
LegacyDialog.216: Your next step should be to explore the corrupt chasms.  Destroy any shadow orb you find.
LegacyDialog.217: There is an old dungeon not far from here. Now would be a good time to go check it out.
LegacyDialog.218: You should make an attempt to max out your available life. Try to gather twenty hearts.
LegacyDialog.219: There are many treasures to be discovered in the jungle, if you are willing to dig deep enough.
LegacyDialog.22: The last guy who was here left me some junk... er I mean... treasures!
LegacyDialog.220: The underworld is made of a material called hellstone. It's perfect for making weapons and armor.
LegacyDialog.221: When you are ready to challenge the keeper of the underworld, you will have to make a living sacrifice. Everything you need for it can be found in the underworld.
LegacyDialog.222: Make sure to smash any demon altar you can find. Something good is bound to happen if you do!
LegacyDialog.223: Souls can sometimes be gathered from fallen creatures in places of extreme light or dark.
LegacyDialog.224: Ho ho ho, and a bottle of... Egg Nog!
LegacyDialog.225: Care to bake me some cookies?
LegacyDialog.226: What? You thought I wasn't real?
LegacyDialog.227: I managed to sew your face back on. Be more careful next time.
LegacyDialog.228: That's probably going to leave a scar.
LegacyDialog.229: All better. I don't want to see you jumping off anymore cliffs.
LegacyDialog.23: I wonder if the moon is made of cheese...huh, what? Oh yes, buy something!
LegacyDialog.230: That didn't hurt too bad, now did it?
LegacyDialog.231: As if living underground wasn't bad enough, jerks like you come in while I'm sleeping and steal my children.
LegacyDialog.232: Between you and me, {Dryad} is the only one I trust. She is the only one here who hasn't tried to eat me or use me in a potion.
LegacyDialog.233: I tried to lick myself the other day to see what the big deal was, everything started glowing blue.
LegacyDialog.234: Everytime I see the color blue, it makes me depressed and lazy.
LegacyDialog.235: You haven't seen any pigs around here have you? My brother lost his leg to one.
LegacyDialog.236: Everyone in this town feels a bit off. I woke up to the clothier chewing on my foot last night.
LegacyDialog.237: I'll give you a discount on your wears if you can convince {Truffle} to come over for a...sizing.
LegacyDialog.238: I feel like {Truffle} is a bit misunderstood, he really is a fun guy.
LegacyDialog.24: Did you say gold?  I'll take that off of ya.
LegacyDialog.240: I don't know the 'Truffle Shuffle,' so stop asking!
LegacyDialog.241: There's been such a huge rumor that's being spread about me, 'If you can't beat him, eat him!'
LegacyDialog.242: Oy, whatchu got in you jiminy fluffer?
LegacyDialog.243: Should I become an air pirate? I've considered becoming an air pirate.
LegacyDialog.244: Be it what it would, a jetpack would suit you nicely!
LegacyDialog.245: I'm feeling a bit peevish as of late, so enough with your palaver you ragamuffin!
LegacyDialog.246: I'm mighty curious about that {Cyborg} fellow. By what manner of consumption does he maintain such locomotion?
LegacyDialog.247: That captain fellow seems to me to be 'pretty well over the bay' if you know what I mean!
LegacyDialog.249: I like your... gear. Does it come in brass?
LegacyDialog.25: You better not get blood on me.
LegacyDialog.250: Once you enter hallowed land, you will see a rainbow in the sky. I can help you with painting that if you want.
LegacyDialog.251: Check out {PartyGirl}. Now that's a girl who can paint the town red!
LegacyDialog.252: I know the difference between turquoise and blue-green. But I won't tell you.
LegacyDialog.253: I'm all out of titanium white, so don't even ask.
LegacyDialog.254: Try swirly pink and purple, it works, I swear!
LegacyDialog.255: No, no, no... There's TONS of different grays! Don't get me started...
LegacyDialog.256: I hope it doesn't rain again until this paint dries. That would be a disaster!
LegacyDialog.257: I bring you the richest colors in exchange for your riches!
LegacyDialog.258: My dear, what you're wearing is much too drab. You absolutely must take a lesson in dyeing your tired attire!
LegacyDialog.259: The only kind of wood I would bother dyeing is RICH Mahogany. Dyeing any other wood is such a waste.
LegacyDialog.260: You must do something about {Pirate}.  Everytime he comes over here, it takes me a week to get the smell off!
LegacyDialog.261: Which doctor am I? The Witch Doctor am I.
LegacyDialog.262: The heart of magic is nature. The nature of hearts is magic.
LegacyDialog.263: {Nurse} may help heal your body, but I can make you embody healing.
LegacyDialog.264: Choose wisely, {PlayerName}, my commodities are volatile and my dark arts, mysterious.
LegacyDialog.265: We have to talk. It's... it's about parties.
LegacyDialog.266: I can't decide what I like more: parties, or after-parties.
LegacyDialog.267: We should set up a blinkroot party, and we should also set up an after-party.
LegacyDialog.268: Wow, {PlayerName}, meeting an adventurous man like you makes me want to party!
LegacyDialog.269: Put up a disco ball and then I'll show you how to party.
LegacyDialog.27: If you're going to die, do it outside.
LegacyDialog.270: I went to Sweden once, they party hard, why aren't you like that?
LegacyDialog.271: My name's {PartyGirl} but people call me party pooper. Yeah I don't know, it sounds cool though.
LegacyDialog.272: Do you party? Sometimes? Hm, okay then we can talk...
LegacyDialog.273: I'm no landlubber, but it's better to have lubbed and lost than never to have lubbed at all.
LegacyDialog.274: Yo ho ho and a bottle of....blinkroots!
LegacyDialog.275: YAR!  Funny ye should be mentionin' parrots b'cause...um...What t'were we talkin' 'bout?
LegacyDialog.276: {PlayerName}, Ye be one o' the finest lookin' lassies this here captain's seen in many a fortnight!
LegacyDialog.277: Stay off me booty, ya scallywag!
LegacyDialog.278: What in blazes are ye talkin' about? Moby Dick is mine!
LegacyDialog.28: What is that supposed to mean?!
LegacyDialog.280: And then Unit 492-8 said, 'Who do you think I am, Unit 472-6?' HA. HA. HA.
LegacyDialog.281: My expedition efficiency was critically reduced when a projectile impacted my locomotive actuator.
LegacyDialog.282: This sentence is false, or is it?
LegacyDialog.283: So that 'punk' lookin' chick is an inventor, eh? I think I could show her a thing or two!
LegacyDialog.284: Sure, me and {Pirate} are pals, but I hate it when his parrot does his business on me. That stuff's corrosive!
LegacyDialog.285: I built myself a taste mechanism, so I can drink some ale!
LegacyDialog.286: Sometimes I come off a bit... Get it? a bit?
LegacyDialog.287: Short back and sides' is it?
LegacyDialog.288: Those highlights really bring out your eyes!
LegacyDialog.289: My hands are sticky from all that... wax.
LegacyDialog.29: I don't think I like your tone.
LegacyDialog.290: Tea? Coffee? Or is it just orange juice again?
LegacyDialog.291: Doll, we seriously need to fix those split ends.
LegacyDialog.292: Gurrllll! You are my favorite gossip ever.
LegacyDialog.293: Which aftershave can I interest you in today, sir?
LegacyDialog.294: Sit down for a second and I'll have you steppin' razor.
LegacyDialog.295: Either you have style, or you get styled.
LegacyDialog.296: For you I think we'll do something... low maintenance.
LegacyDialog.297: I tried using one of the Dye Master's products once. Ends fried. Disaster.
LegacyDialog.298: Oh you poor, poor thing. Just... just sit down here. It'll be okay. Shhhh.
LegacyDialog.3: I feel like an evil presence is watching me.
LegacyDialog.30: Why are you even here? If you aren't bleeding, you don't need to be here. Get out.
LegacyDialog.300: Hello sir, I'm {Stylist}, and I'll be your barber today.
LegacyDialog.301: Just a little off the top?  That's no fun...
LegacyDialog.302: I hope you like what I did to {PartyGirl}'s hair!
LegacyDialog.303: There is nothing I can do for {Demolitionist}'s singed head. He's a lost cause.
LegacyDialog.304: Tipping IS optional, but remember I have access to scissors and your head.
LegacyDialog.305: This is a cut-throat razor by the way.
LegacyDialog.306: You better stay outta my hair tonight, hun. I just sharpened my scissors, and I'm looking for an excuse to use them!
LegacyDialog.307: Mhmm, I heard from {PartyGirl} that {Mechanic}'s friend {Nurse} spent her boyfriend's last paycheck on shoes.
LegacyDialog.308: One time I put a wig on {Cyborg} just so I could cut his hair. I think he kinda liked it!
LegacyDialog.309: I tried to visit {Stylist} one time. She just looked at me and said 'nope.'
LegacyDialog.310: I think it is about time I got my hair did!
LegacyDialog.311: Did you even try to brush your hair today?
LegacyDialog.312: So a pixie cut, would you like to keep some lady burns?
LegacyDialog.313: I have no problem cleaning up ears and eyebrows, but I draw the line at nose hair.
LegacyDialog.314: Alright, you sit and marinate. I'll be back to rinse your color out in 25 minutes...
LegacyDialog.315: Thanks hun! Now I can finally do my hair.
LegacyDialog.316: I would have given you a free cut if you'd come earlier.
LegacyDialog.317: Don't go exploring with scissors, they said. You won't get trapped in a spider's web, they said!
LegacyDialog.318: Ew, my hair, there's spider web all over it!
LegacyDialog.319: Meet me behind {Guide}'s house in about three hours, I think I have something you will find very appealing.
LegacyDialog.32: Have you seen that old man pacing around the dungeon? He looks troubled.
LegacyDialog.320: That {Merchant}, he really has no appreciation for a really good deal.
LegacyDialog.321: I sell only what I can get. {Clothier} keeps hounding me for exotic clothing.
LegacyDialog.322: Hmm, you look like you could use an Angel Statue! They slice, and dice, and make everything nice!
LegacyDialog.323: I don't refund for "buyer's remorse..." Or for any other reason, really.
LegacyDialog.324: Buy now and get free shipping!
LegacyDialog.325: I sell wares from places that might not even exist!
LegacyDialog.326: You want two penny farthings!? Make it one and we have a deal.
LegacyDialog.327: Combination hookah and coffee maker! Also makes julienne fries!
LegacyDialog.328: Come and have a look! One pound fish! Very, very good! One pound fish!
LegacyDialog.329: If you're looking for junk, you've come to the wrong place.
LegacyDialog.33: I wish {Demolitionist} would be more careful.  I'm getting tired of having to sew his limbs back on every day.
LegacyDialog.330: A thrift shop?  No, I am only selling the highest quality items on the market.
LegacyDialog.331: Smashing a crimson heart will sometimes cause a meteor to fall out of the sky. Crimson hearts can usually be found in the chasms around crimtane areas.
LegacyDialog.332: Have you tried using purification powder on the crimstone of the crimson?
LegacyDialog.333: You must cleanse the world of this crimson.
LegacyDialog.334: Psst! I might have a job for you. Don't think you can say no, either!
LegacyDialog.335: I want a fish and you're going to find me one! Ask me about it!
LegacyDialog.336: Hey! Just the sacrifi- I mean competent fishing master that I've been looking for!
LegacyDialog.337: {Angler} wants YOU as the official {WorldName} errand monkey!
LegacyDialog.338: Whaaaat?! Can't you see I'm winding up fishing line??
LegacyDialog.339: I have enough fish! I don't need your help right now!
LegacyDialog.34: Hey, has {ArmsDealer} mentioned needing to go to the doctor for any reason? Just wondering.
LegacyDialog.340: There's no chefs in all of {WorldName}, so I have to cook all this fish myself!
LegacyDialog.341: Hey! Watch it! I'm setting up traps for my biggest prank ever! No one will see it coming! Don't you dare tell anyone!
LegacyDialog.342: Let a kid give you some advice, never touch your tongue to an ice block! Wait, forget what I said, I totally want to see you do it!
LegacyDialog.343: Ever heard of a barking fish?! I haven't, I'm just wondering if you did!
LegacyDialog.344: {WorldName} is filled to the brim with the most outlandish kinds of fish!
LegacyDialog.345: I'm bummed out! There's probably been fish that have gone extinct before I even was born, and that's not fair!
LegacyDialog.346: I don't have a mommy or a daddy, but I have a lot of fish! It's close enough!
LegacyDialog.347: Heh heh, you shoulda seen the look on {Dryad}'s face when I stuck that piranha tooth in the chair!
LegacyDialog.348: I have a request for you! No, I don't care that there's a zombie apocalypse right now!
LegacyDialog.349: Hurry up and listen! I need you to catch something for me right now!
LegacyDialog.35: I need to have a serious talk with {Guide}. How many times a week can you come in with severe lava burns?
LegacyDialog.350: I hate Blood Moons! I stay up all night because of all the scary noises!
LegacyDialog.351: Blood Moon is the worst time to fish! The fish bite, yes, but so do the zombies!
LegacyDialog.352: There's a bajillion monsters running around out there right now!
LegacyDialog.353: Thanks, I guess, for saving me or whatever. You'd be a great helper minion!
LegacyDialog.354: Wha? Who might you be? I totally wasn't just drowning or anything!
LegacyDialog.355: You saved me! You're awful nice, I could use you... er, I mean, totally hire you to do some awesome stuff for me!
LegacyDialog.356: Got any spare bones for sale? I'm looking to replace my broken hip... again.
LegacyDialog.357: Excellent! Someone's finally come by to take some of these maggots off my hands.
LegacyDialog.358: There's no illness or condition that can't be cured by some of my Slime Oil! Trust me, it works, just look at my lively figure!
LegacyDialog.359: You've got a real backbone coming way down here, how 'bout ya buy somethin?
LegacyDialog.36: I think you look better this way.
LegacyDialog.360: You would not believe some of the things people throw at me... Wanna buy some of it?
LegacyDialog.361: I'd lend you a hand, but last time I did that, I didn't get it back for a month.
LegacyDialog.362: Stay away from the spiders. They'll suck out your insides and leave you a hollow shell of a man. Trust me on this one.
LegacyDialog.363: The only things constant in this world are death and taxes, I've got both!
LegacyDialog.364: You again? Suppose you want more money!?
LegacyDialog.365: Must everyone open and shut doors so incredibly noisily around here?!
LegacyDialog.366: I see you're free of time, as usual. Can't imagine what work life would be for your kind of folk.
LegacyDialog.367: Yes, yes, yes! -- I'll give you your share in just a moment. I'd think you to be a bit more patient, what with me doing all the work and all.
LegacyDialog.368: What does a man have to do to be left alone in this place? Go bugger someone less busy!
LegacyDialog.369: ...two barrels of molasses, plus -- Oh, nevermind that, you're here. Here's your money.
LegacyDialog.37: Eww... What happened to your face?
LegacyDialog.370: Just between you and me... I have no idea why they're bothering to pay the rent
LegacyDialog.371: Tried to get {Dryad} to pay me with favors once, now I have fungus growing in strange places.
LegacyDialog.372: Go tell {ArmsDealer} to stop offering to pay me with ammo, I don't even own a gun.
LegacyDialog.373: Why don't YOU try collecting money from {Demolitionist} and not lose a hand or foot or...
LegacyDialog.374: I just came from {Merchant}'s. He wanted to know if I took credit cards.
LegacyDialog.38: MY GOODNESS! I'm good, but I'm not THAT good.
LegacyDialog.380: Here's your cut of the taxes that I've taken from our surplus population!
LegacyDialog.381: Here you are again, taking all my coin! Just grab it and begone from my sight!
LegacyDialog.382: Bah! Here, take your shillings and get out of my sight!
LegacyDialog.383: This is all you're gonna get for now, not a penny more! Take it and spend it wisely.
LegacyDialog.39: Dear friends we are gathered here today to bid farewell... Oh, you'll be fine.
LegacyDialog.390: ...And people call me greedy? No, I have nothing else for you.
LegacyDialog.391: Oh, so you just see me as a coin sign, eh? 'Cus every time you see me, you ask me.
LegacyDialog.392: Don't you ever stop just to say 'Hi?'
LegacyDialog.393: Bah! You again? You just grabbed some of my coin just moments ago, so bugger off and come back later!
LegacyDialog.394: I just gave you half a crown five minutes ago! Scram!
LegacyDialog.395: Reaching into my moneybags again already!? And you call ME greedy.
LegacyDialog.396: You just received your pay, and not a farthing more! Get out!
LegacyDialog.397: Money doesn't grow on trees, so don't overpick my fruit! Bah!
LegacyDialog.398: You already managed to spend every pence I paid you!? Bah, I'm not a charity, go kill a slime!
LegacyDialog.399: Not so fast! You got your money, now begone!
LegacyDialog.4: Sword beats paper! Get one today.
LegacyDialog.40: You left your arm over there. Let me get that for you...
LegacyDialog.400: Begging so soon?! Don't look at me like I'll have a change of heart overnight!
LegacyDialog.401: Make sure to smash any crimson altar you can find. Something good is bound to happen if you do!
LegacyDialog.402: Crimson altars can usually be found in the crimson. You will need to be near them to craft some items.
LegacyDialog.403: You can create a bloody spine with vertebrae. Make sure you are in a crimson area before using it.
LegacyDialog.404: I think you are ready for your first major battle. Gather some lenses from the eyeballs at night and take them to a crimson altar.
LegacyDialog.41: Quit being such a baby! I've seen worse.
LegacyDialog.44: Hold on, I've got some cartoon bandages around here somewhere.
LegacyDialog.45: Walk it off, {PlayerName}, you'll be fine. Sheesh.
LegacyDialog.46: Does it hurt when you do that? Don't do that.
LegacyDialog.47: You look half digested. Have you been chasing slimes again?
LegacyDialog.49: That's not the biggest I've ever seen... Yes, I've seen bigger wounds for sure.
LegacyDialog.5: You want apples? You want carrots? You want pineapples? We got torches.
LegacyDialog.52: I'm sorry, but you can't afford me.
LegacyDialog.53: I'm gonna need more gold than that.
LegacyDialog.54: I don't work for free you know.
LegacyDialog.56: I can't do anymore for you without plastic surgery.
LegacyDialog.58: I heard there is a doll that looks very similar to {Guide} somewhere in the underworld.  I'd like to put a few rounds in it.
LegacyDialog.59: Make it quick! I've got a date with {Nurse} in an hour.
LegacyDialog.6: Lovely morning, wouldn't you say? Was there something you needed?
LegacyDialog.60: I want what {Nurse} is sellin'. What do you mean, she doesn't sell anything?
LegacyDialog.61: {Dryad} is a looker.  Too bad she's such a prude.
LegacyDialog.62: Don't bother with {Demolitionist}, I've got all you need right here.
LegacyDialog.63: What's {Demolitionist}'s problem? Does he even realize we sell completely different stuff?
LegacyDialog.64: Man, it's a good night not to talk to anybody, don't you think, {PlayerName}?
LegacyDialog.65: I love nights like tonight.  There is never a shortage of things to kill!
LegacyDialog.66: I see you're eyeballin' the Minishark.. You really don't want to know how it was made.
LegacyDialog.67: Hey, this ain't a movie, pal. Ammo is extra.
LegacyDialog.68: Keep your hands off my gun, buddy!
LegacyDialog.69: Have you tried using purification powder on the ebonstone of the corruption?
LegacyDialog.7: Night will be upon us soon, friend. Make your choices while you can.
LegacyDialog.70: I wish {ArmsDealer} would stop flirting with me. Doesn't he realize I'm 500 years old?
LegacyDialog.71: Why does {Merchant} keep trying to sell me angel statues? Everyone knows that they don't do anything.
LegacyDialog.72: Have you seen the old man walking around the dungeon? He doesn't look well at all...
LegacyDialog.73: I sell what I want! If you don't like it, too bad.
LegacyDialog.74: Why do you have to be so confrontational during a time like this?
LegacyDialog.75: I don't want you to buy my stuff. I want you to want to buy my stuff, ok?
LegacyDialog.76: Dude, is it just me or is there like a million zombies out tonight?
LegacyDialog.77: You must cleanse the world of this corruption.
LegacyDialog.79: The sands of time are flowing. And well, you are not aging very gracefully.
LegacyDialog.8: You have no idea how much Dirt Blocks sell for overseas.
LegacyDialog.80: What's this about me having more 'bark' than bite?
LegacyDialog.81: So two goblins walk into a bar, and one says to the other, 'Want to get a Goblet of beer?!
LegacyDialog.82: I cannot let you enter until you free me of my curse.
LegacyDialog.83: Come back at night if you wish to enter.
LegacyDialog.84: My master cannot be summoned under the light of day.
LegacyDialog.85: You are far too weak to defeat my curse.  Come back when you aren't so worthless.
LegacyDialog.86: You pathetic fool.  You cannot hope to face my master as you are now.
LegacyDialog.87: I hope you have like six friends standing around behind you.
LegacyDialog.88: Please, no, stranger. You'll only get yourself killed.
LegacyDialog.89: You just might be strong enough to free me from my curse...
LegacyDialog.9: Ah, they will tell tales of {PlayerName} some day... good ones I'm sure.
LegacyDialog.90: Stranger, do you possess the strength to defeat my master?
LegacyDialog.91: Please! Battle my captor and free me! I beg you!
LegacyDialog.92: Defeat my master, and I will grant you passage into the Dungeon.
LegacyDialog.93: Trying to get past that {WorldEvilStone}, eh? Why not introduce it to one of these explosives!
LegacyDialog.94: Hey, have you seen a clown around?
LegacyDialog.95: There was a bomb sitting right here, and now I can't seem to find it...
LegacyDialog.96: I've got something for them zombies alright!
LegacyDialog.98: Would you rather have a bullet hole or a grenade hole? That's what I thought.
LegacyDialog.99: I'm sure {Nurse} will help if you accidentally lose a limb to these.

LegacyMisc.13: Your world has been blessed with Mythril!
LegacyMisc.14: Your world has been blessed with Adamantite!

LegacyMisc.9: You feel an evil presence watching you...

AnglerQuestChatter.Chatter_1: Wooow! You've bothered me, like, {AnglerCompletedQuestsCount} times! If I didn't have a cool fish for each time, I would be really mad!
AnglerQuestChatter.Chatter_2: Did you know I have {AnglerCompletedQuestsCount} amazingly awesome fish now!? That's because as far as errand monkeys go, you're actually a bit useful!

BartenderChatter.Chatter_1: I've got the cure for what ails ya! Get it? Ale? No?
BartenderChatter.Chatter_2: They say you're strong, well, I know strong. Let's see if you measure up.
BartenderChatter.Chatter_3: Back where I'm from, we only serve Root Beer...
BartenderChatter.Chatter_4: This is a big upgrade from wiping that table all day.
BartenderChatter.Chatter_5: Life's a challenge when you're just naturally better than everyone else.
BartenderChatter.Chatter_7: A lot of tenacity and a little bit of luck can go a long way...
BartenderChatter.Chatter_8: Have you seen any Meburs around here?
BartenderChatter.Chatter_9: {Dryad} seems nice. I should bring her back with me.
BartenderChatter.Chatter_10: Do you think {Steampunker} has an extra of that gun? I know a witch that may want one.
BartenderChatter.Chatter_11: No wonder {Demolitionist} has so many accidents. You can't imagine how much ale he buys from me.
BartenderChatter.Chatter_12: Normally, I'm not much of a fan of Goblins, but {GoblinTinkerer} seems to be an alright sort.
BartenderChatter.Chatter_14: {?!Day}Really quiet out there. A little too quiet...
BartenderChatter.Chatter_15: {?!Day}Check in with me, and do your job.
BartenderChatter.Chatter_16: {?BloodMoon}You know, where I'm from, a Blood Moon is actually just an excuse to get some fresh air.
BartenderChatter.Chatter_17: {?MoonLordDefeated}Moon Lord, don't you mean Abyss Lord?
BartenderChatter.Chatter_18: {?HardMode}I know a Lavamancer that would really like that hellstone down in the underworld.
BartenderChatter.Chatter_19: {?Homeless}Know any good places to set up shop? Would love to open up a bar here.

GolferChatter.Chatter_1: I'm not the type to scream and thrash around just because my ball lands in the water. I stay calm, and collected, and focus on the next shot.
GolferChatter.Chatter_2: Huh? You eat WHAT for breakfast?
GolferChatter.Chatter_3: An early bird catches the worm, but an early hole catches the birdie.
GolferChatter.Chatter_4: Lick your finger and hold it to the wind. Golf balls are lightweight and easily influenced by a breeze.
GolferChatter.Chatter_5: If sand is causing you nightmares, your wedge is your dreamcatcher.
GolferChatter.Chatter_6: Should I take up fishing? Bribing {Angler} to fetch my balls out of the water is emptying my wallet!
GolferChatter.Chatter_7: To strike high, strike far, or to get unstuck? It's all about the club you use. Choose wisely!
GolferChatter.Chatter_8: When I offer you to go clubbing, I don't mean downtown. I mean like, with a five iron?
GolferChatter.Chatter_9: In this game, only losers go for that high score.
GolferChatter.Chatter_10: Landscapers must make a lot of green off us golfers. Heh!
GolferChatter.Chatter_11: {Armsdealer} has mistaken my golf balls as ammo for his musket on several occassions.
GolferChatter.Chatter_12: According to {Dryad}, I'm murdering a lot of her friends when I mow the lawn. I gotta have a fairway for my course!
GolferChatter.Chatter_13: If you land on the green, use a putter! Don't let your balls go flying away when you're THAT close.
GolferChatter.Chatter_14: Don't go chasing water hazards, please stick to the fairways and greens that you're used to.
GolferChatter.Chatter_15: {?BloodMoon}The blood stains on my club? Have you seen the zombies outside?!
GolferChatter.Chatter_16: {?BloodMoon}I don't know what's scarier, a Blood Moon or my sister during a Blood Moon!
GolferChatter.Chatter_17: {?Rain}Golfing in THIS weather?! Only if you like swinging around a giant lightning rod!

BestiaryGirlChatter.Chatter_1: I collected critters like you once, then I took a cursed fox bite to the knee!
BestiaryGirlChatter.Chatter_2: {?Eclipse}Like wow, I feel like I belong with the creepy killer things running around right now. So glad I'm not that mindless.
BestiaryGirlChatter.Chatter_3: I may not know, like, a whole lot...but I can talk your head off about nature and critters and animals and wildlife and...
BestiaryGirlChatter.Chatter_4: My older bro calls me a lycanthrope. It means I'm like, part animal or something. He'd know, though, because he spends all his time outside!
BestiaryGirlChatter.Chatter_5: I love animals, like, a lot! I tried to pet this weird looking fox one time, he sooo bit me, and now I became like one! Rad!
BestiaryGirlChatter.Chatter_6: Staahp pulling on my tail, bro, it's totally real, and like...totally hurts when you pull on it!
BestiaryGirlChatter.Chatter_7: Huh?! No, {Stylist} didn't dye my hair. It's naturally this color! It was like, dark brown before I was bitten, though!
BestiaryGirlChatter.Chatter_8: Oh, THESE ears? Haha, totes better to hear you with, my dear!
BestiaryGirlChatter.Chatter_9: This one time, at critter camp, I woke up one morning and everything was torn apart! Like, wow, how did I sleep through THAT?!
BestiaryGirlChatter.Chatter_10: Wow, like, I've never seen a full moon. For some reason, it's like I pass out every time one's around!
BestiaryGirlChatter.Chatter_11: I have noooo idea how I got here, but it's mega rad.

PrincessChatter.Chatter_1: I really appreciate all the good you've done for this land! Thank you!
PrincessChatter.Chatter_2: Goblins are so cute! They are short, and have those little pointy ears, and they come in different colors!
PrincessChatter.Chatter_3: I tried to pet a lihzahrd once. Um... they didn't mind at all!
PrincessChatter.Chatter_4: I wish the martians were a little nicer. Our world doesn't normally get visitors!
PrincessChatter.Chatter_5: Like my dress? Gee, thanks! Just sewed it.
PrincessChatter.Chatter_6: I am so fabulously grateful for my subjects!
PrincessChatter.Chatter_7: Worry not, concerned citizen! I am well aware of the organized crime problem among snowfolk.
PrincessChatter.Chatter_8: Hmm... do you think {Pirate} will be able to redeem some of his old seafaring friends, as well?
PrincessChatter.Chatter_9: Diplomacy did not work so well with the Ice Queen, I'm afraid. She's rather cold-hearted! He he!
PrincessChatter.Chatter_10: The Pumpking can be rather two-faced, it seems. I shall not give up on peace with his spooky people!
PrincessChatter.Chatter_11: Pink is the best color anyone could ask for!
PrincessChatter.Chatter_12: I once met with a Duke on the beach. He looked kinda fishy, and lacked good manners!
PrincessChatter.Chatter_13: Um... being a princess can be so uneventful sometimes, so I took up many hobbies!
PrincessChatter.Chatter_14: I'm so happy to finally travel the world, and meet new people!
PrincessChatter.Chatter_15: As much as I love people, I am rather shy. It takes me awhile to break the ice...
PrincessChatter.Chatter_16: {?BloodMoon}The rivers are running red, everyone seem awfully on edge, hmm... it's a trying night, indeed!
PrincessChatter.Chatter_17: {?!Day}The stars at night remind me of glitter on a beautiful, black dress. I shall soon have one made!

BestiaryGirlSpecialText.Party: So, uh, I can't wear the hat. Sorry. I'm still here for the party, no worries!
BestiaryGirlSpecialText.Graveyard1: My instincts are totally going wild. I really need to get out of here!
BestiaryGirlSpecialText.Graveyard2: Ok, like, this place is totally freaky. It makes my fur stand on end!
BestiaryGirlSpecialText.Windy1: Running in the wind makes me feel so free and wild. Totes try it sometime!
BestiaryGirlSpecialText.Windy2: The breeze blows through my hair, it's, like, woah.
BestiaryGirlSpecialText.Storm1: Eek!! You have NO idea how much thunder hurts my sensitive ears.
BestiaryGirlSpecialText.Storm2: Is it over yet? I have this, like, irrational fear of thunderstorms.
BestiaryGirlSpecialText.Rain1: Staaaap! Ugh! Not you, this lame rain.
BestiaryGirlSpecialText.Rain2: For real!? I can't STAND being wet! It's gross.

BartenderHelpText.Help_1: The first thing you need to know about are the special defensive artifacts I've got for sale, but only if you've got some Defender Medals!
BartenderHelpText.Help_2: You can use these artifacts to create traps and defensive towers. Doing so consumes Etherian mana, a special energy dropped only by members of the Old One's Army!
BartenderHelpText.Help_3: Challenging the Old One's Army is rather simple. They are attracted to the power of the Eternia Crystals, and that can be used to bait them out.
BartenderHelpText.Help_4: To place an Eternia Crystal, you must obtain an Eternia Crystal and a stand to put it in. It just so happens, you can buy em from me!
BartenderHelpText.Help_5: You'll want to place your Eternia Crystal stand in a pretty open, flat area. Lots of walls and stuff might make it pretty difficult to protect!
BartenderHelpText.Help_6: Once your stand is set up, just interact with it while holding an Eternia Crystal, and prepare for a fight!
BartenderHelpText.Help_7: Of course, you can't let the Old One's Army destroy the Eternia Crystal! This will have catastrophic consequences for my home world of Etheria!
BartenderHelpText.Help_8: You can place defenses at the cost of 10 Etherian mana. Once placed, the Eternia Crystal will release some of this mana. Otherwise, you will need to defeat enemies to get more.
BartenderHelpText.Help_9: With the help of the defenses, you will have to repel several waves of invaders who are attempting to destroy both you and the Eternia Crystal!
BartenderHelpText.Help_10: If you successfully repel the invasion, you'll be awarded with more Defender Medals, which you can bring to me to purchase more artifacts and some other special rewards!
BartenderHelpText.Help_11: I've also heard rumors that the power of the artifacts themselves may be further unlocked if you defeat the Old One's Army. Perhaps you could even use them any time you wish!

GuideHelpText.Help_1063: Normally I'd try to teach you all about the Old One's Army, but you should probably ask {Bartender} about that.
GuideHelpText.Help_1064: When the moon goes red, the water becomes like blood. Creatures submerged within may become grotesque and malicious.

GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1100: I hear a race of lizardmen live in the jungle. Maybe you can get the attention of one by felling a giant beast of the jungle?
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1101: I hear there's a woman out there well-versed in fighting back the forces you just unleashed. Maybe if you prove yourself, you can get her attention.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1102: Machines aren't so bad. Maybe we can build one of our own, if we can just get some explosive weaponry from the jungle...
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1103: I once met a stylist in this region. She went off adventuring underground and that was the last I saw of her. Wonder what became of her?
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1104: Ever caught a strange fish and you aren't sure what to do with it? I hear a fishing master lives near the ocean who might have a use for those...
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1105: The Tortured Soul down in the Underworld sure looks familiar...have you tried using Purification Powder on him?
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1106: There have been some pirates sighted around lately. If we befriend one, you think he might show us where he buried his treasure?
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1107: There are some special plants and other ingredients that can be used to dye things. Maybe if you keep some with you, you'll find someone to show you how.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1108: I've heard of glowing mushrooms growing big enough on the surface to gain sentience. Wonder if there's any truth to that...
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1109: They say sand is terrible for golfing. No self-respecting golfer would ever be caught in a desert...right?
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1110: Artists like to practice their craft, and painters like to paint. If enough people move in, we'll have enough homes that a painter might show up to spruce up the place!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1111: A lot of people have moved in lately, haven't they? If it gets much more busy around here, a party girl will surely move in!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1112: Always keep an eye out for strangers in need! You never know when you might meet someone new who is in need of help.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1113: If {Merchant}'s wares don't interest you, a wandering merchant often visits with exotic merchandise you might prefer.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1114: Not all of the undead monsters are hostile. I hear one even sells merchandise deep underground.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1115: This world is full of many exciting and dangerous creatures to discover. There are some experts who might reward you for sharing that knowledge with them!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1120: If you thought rainy days were a drag, wait till you see it raining slime!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1121: On rare occasions, the moon will blot out the sun, bringing out lots of scary monsters!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1122: Ever seen the Goblin Scouts in the outer regions of the world? I wonder if an invasion is imminent...
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1123: I think I saw a treasure map floating around in the ocean once, but a shark ate it. Maybe you should go try and find one?
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1124: I saw some flashing lights, high up in the sky and far away. The truth is out there, I'm telling you.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1125: Have you ever seen beautiful lanterns floating across the night sky? The people of this world celebrate your victories, wishing you good fortune.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1130: If you place an empty bottle on a table, you can use it to craft all sorts of neat potions!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1131: Hang up any banners you earn from defeating foes, as they will help you in future combat with that creature.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1132: It's pretty cold in the snow biome, but there are some unique treasures there as well. I'd check it out!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1133: There are antlion tunnels deep beneath the desert, full of rare fossils and many hazards!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1134: If you find a marble biome, be careful! They say that those locations are inhabited by some very dangerous creatures!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1135: In granite biomes, the very stone itself is a threat, frequently coming to life and attacking intruders!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1136: Need to craft something with ores you can't find on {WorldName}? Try fishing for crates, or placing silt and slush into the Extractinator!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1137: If you ever need a break from all this adventuring, there's always time for some good old fashioned fishing.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1138: While you explore the underground, you may occasionally encounter helpful fairies. If you follow them, maybe they will lead you to treasure!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1140: Your next step should be to explore the caverns of the Crimson. Find and destroy any Crimson Hearts that you come across.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1141: The Crimstone in the Crimson can be purified using some powder from a Dryad, or it can be destroyed with explosives.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1142: Try to gather some obsidian, formed when water and lava meet. It can be used to protect against intense heat.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1143: Some say there are giant bee hives buried underground in the jungle. I could do with some honey myself.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1144: You found some old fossils in the desert? I wonder if there is a way to extract them from the rock.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1145: It's time to upgrade that old Furnace! Look for a Hellforge in the Underworld, it's the only way to craft Hellstone bars.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1146: Have you seen the Wyverns soaring high up in the clouds? If only I could fly like that...
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1147: Try combining a Hellforge with some adamantite ore. I bet you could make some really powerful stuff with that!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1148: Try combining a Hellforge with some titanium ore. I bet you could make some really powerful stuff with that!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1149: Run into any rare fruit growing in the jungle lately? If you eat it, it will increase your max life!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1150: I've heard of glowing pink bulbs growing around the jungle recently. Be ready for anything if you decide to harvest one.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1151: That key you have can be used to unlock the Temple hidden in the jungle. Have you found it yet?
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1152: They say that there is a sealed Temple, hidden away in the jungle. I wonder how you could open it?
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1153: Wow, that key you have is pretty nifty! I heard keys like that can be used to get rare treasure in the Dungeon!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1154: I've heard reports of a very strange worm in the underground mushroom fields. I wonder if it would be any good as bait?
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1155: Ancient prophecies speak of a way to summon the monstrous hordes of Halloween through medallions crafted with pumpkins.
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1156: Legends tell of a cursed gift that can turn the most festive of nights into an invasion of horrors!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1157: There are some strange people in hoods loitering outside of the Dungeon. Maybe you should check it out?
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1158: Where the heck did those Pillars come from?! You should clear out some of the monsters around them!
GuideHelpTextSpecific.Help_1159: If you combine lenses at a crimson altar, you might be able to find a way to summon a powerful monster. You will want to wait until night before using it, though.

AnglerQuestText.NoQuest_1: I don't have anything for you to do right now.
AnglerQuestText.NoQuest_2: You have entertained me enough for today, go.
AnglerQuestText.NoQuest_3: You are done, the grand {Angler} dismisses you!
AnglerQuestText.NoQuest_4: Only one fish a day, please go away!
AnglerQuestText.NoQuest_5: I haven't even used the last fish you gave me.  I don't need another.
AnglerQuestText.TurnIn_1: Oh! Thanks for the fish I asked for, now scram!
AnglerQuestText.TurnIn_2: Awesome catch! It's all going according to plan! He he he!
AnglerQuestText.TurnIn_3: You make a great errand monkey! Now go away!
AnglerQuestText.TurnIn_4: Muahahahahaha! You did it! You're still in one piece though, how boring!
AnglerQuestText.TurnIn_5: Woah!? You actually did what I asked, and survived! Nice, hand it over and beat it!
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Batfish:
Na na na na na na na Bat-FISH! That means go digging underground, fetch it, and bring it to me!

(Caught in Underground & Caverns)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_BumblebeeTuna:
The subterranean jungles of {WorldName} have the weirdest things! Like, there's this fish I saw that looked just like a giant bumblebee! I'm allergic to bees, so you have to catch it for me! I bet it'd taste like a tuna and honey sandwich!

(Caught in Honey)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Catfish:
I finally found a jungle cat that likes water! I think it's because it's also part fish. I don't know why this happened, and I don't want to know. I just want it in my hands, and make it snappy!

(Caught in Jungle Surface)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Cloudfish:
There's a rumor going around that there are islands that float high up in the sky, and that they have amazing treasure! Who cares about that though, what's even cooler is that sometimes lakes form in the clouds, and in those lakes are fish made out of clouds! I wanna know what it tastes like, so you better go catch it for me!

(Caught in Sky Lakes)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Cursedfish:
There's a cursed fish swimming in the waters of the deepest corruption! It was forged of the cursed flames that spread from the fallen horrors that lurk down there. They say not even water can put out this fire, and that it can burn forever. I can think of some awesome things I can do with a fish like that! You gonna go get it for me, or are you too chicken!?

(Caught in Corruption)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Dirtfish:
I was reeling in the big one when this funny talking zombie burst out of the forest lake and started rambling on about this 'ferocious' species of fish made out of dirt! He says it could suffocate ten blokes his size, or something like that... I want it! NOW!

(Caught in Surface & Underground)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_DynamiteFish:
The demolitionist was raising cane about losing a stick of dynamite in the lake out in the forest. He has like, so many, so why does one matter? Apparently, because it grew fins and started swimming away! I don't know where he gets his materials to make those things, but that one is clearly possessed! Reel it in and bring it to me, I always wanted a suicide bombing fish! Don't ask why...

(Caught in Surface)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_EaterofPlankton:
I bet you're not brave enough to find the Eater of Plankton. A corrupt fish that was mutated from a severed piece of the Eater of Worlds itself! Capture it and bring it to me, and prove to me you're not a wuss!

(Caught in Corruption)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_FallenStarfish:
I love collecting those bright yellow stars that fall from the sky! I love it even more when they land on someone's head. But.. but.. nothing beats a star that falls in a foresty lake and turns into a fish! That's just totally rad, and you're just rad enough to get it for me!

(Caught in Sky Lakes)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_TheFishofCthulu:
Apparently, Demon Eyes can sometimes be amphibious. They don't fly, they swim! I want to see the look on someone's face when they find it in their bathtub! They hang around the same areas. That means you reel one in for me!

(Caught in Sky Lakes & Surface)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Fishotron:
I don't know what's worse, a bone fish or a bone fish with HANDS. This Fish-o-Tron deep in the caverns really freaks me out! I think it's possessed by the same evil spirits that possessed that old man by the dungeon! I double duck dare you to go catch it!

(Caught in Caverns)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Harpyfish:
I was trying to sleep by the hill lakeside when this fish swooped down at me. It was flying! It also had the face of a lady and had feathers! I think I screamed louder than she did! Hey you, go make her pay for scaring me like that!

(Caught in Sky Lakes & Surface)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Hungerfish:
There's a piece of the Hunger that morphed from the Wall of Flesh into a small fish-like thing that swims around aimlessly in the underworld and it's gross and it's yucky and I want it now!

(Caught in Caverns)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Ichorfish:
Did you know deep in the crimson, some of those creatures make this gross yellow stuff? I overheard a crazy story about a pool of it having melted together into a shape of a fish and it swims around and everything! Fetch it for me, so I can stick it in someone's toilet!

(Caught in Crimson)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Jewelfish:
Oooooohhh, I'm going to be SO rich! Deep in the caverns, there is a fish made out of gemstones! Don't ask me how, I don't know, all I know is that this fish is totally awesome and you're going to catch it for me!

(Caught in Underground & Caverns)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_MirageFish:
There's some interesting critters to be found in the deeper Hallows, I tell you! They glow this crazy purple color and it messes with my eyes! It's totally wild, so I want you to catch a fish like that for me!

(Caught in Underground Hallow)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_MutantFlinxfin:
What's white and tan and fluffy and lives in a frozen underground lake? A mutant flinxfin! I wasn't telling a joke, you know, there really is a mutated variety of Flinx that is more adapted to an aquatic lifestyle! I want it to adapt to my fishbowl, so make sure that happens!

(Caught in Underground Tundra)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Pengfish:
It's a whale! It's a dolphin! No, it's a penguin fish! Oh, and look, it's you! You get to bring me one! You do know they only like cold water, right?

(Caught in Tundra)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Pixiefish:
There's a really really rare type of pixie that's born with so many wings that it can't actually fly! It swims with the fishes in the lakes surrounded by that blue colored grass. My fish tank needs a lamp, so I want you to catch me that pixie!

(Caught in Hallow)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Spiderfish:
I saw a fish that had eight legs! Nope! Not happening! You're fishing it for me, so it's not alive when I hold it! That's the last time I go fishing so deep in the cavern!

(Caught in Underground & Caverns)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_UnicornFish:
Unicorns and rainbows are absolutely great! They're everywhere, even in the water. No, really, I actually saw a unicorn fish in the Hallowed lake! Your job is to reel it up and let me have it as a pet!

(Caught in Hallow)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_GuideVoodooFish:
Those demons in the underworld really like voodoo dolls, but I think there's a doll out there who was blasted with way too much magic! It turned into a fish and it does stuff on its own. I dare you to go down and get me one! I'd watch out for the boiling lava, because it burns you to death and that won't get me my fish!

(Caught in Caverns)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Wyverntail:
I know something youuuuu don't! Fine, I'll tell you, there's a terrifying creature that flies among the stars! I'm not making this up! It's called a Wyvern! But, but, you knew that already, right? Well what you don't know is that they are born and raised as tadpoles! So, they're actually like.. well, a frog! Hop to it and get me one!

(Caught in Sky Lakes)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_ZombieFish:
You won't believe it! I caught a fish in the forest at night that was already dead! Then it tried to eat me! I threw it away and ran! Now I want to stick it in someone's dresser to see what happens, so go fish it back up for me will ya?!

(Caught in Surface)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_AmanitaFungifin:
I found this spectacular place draped in giant glowing mushrooms! Everything was blue! I was picking some of the mushrooms I found next to a glistening blue lake, when one of the mushrooms snapped at me and swam away! I want to give it a taste of its own medicine, and give it a good chompin'! What I mean is, you gotta get it for me!

(Caught in Glowing Mushroom Fields)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Angelfish:
Did you know there's magical islands that float up high in the sky? Bet you didn't! They say angels live in the sky, and I believe those angels have fins and gills and swim around! I believe you must catch one for me!

(Caught in Sky Lakes)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_BloodyManowar:
Ow! Don't get near me! I got stung by a Bloody Man-O-War! In case you're not smart enough to know what that is, it's the most menacing jellyfish in all of {WorldName}! Go to that rotten crimson and catch it if you dare! 

(Caught in Crimson)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Bonefish:
Normally I could care less if I see fishbones floating in the water underground, but this one was swimming! What, you thought that only human skeletons still flailed about in {WorldName}? Get it for me so I can stick it in someone's bed!

(Caught in Underground & Caverns)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Bunnyfish:
Out in the forest, I was fishing right? Well guess what! A bunny hopped up to me! Then another one hopped up, and another... suddenly I'm surrounded by bunnies! One even swam up to me from the water, but it had no legs! I fell outta my chair in surprise and all the bunnies scurried off! I want that bunny fish as a pet, so you better catch it for me! Pronto!

(Caught in Surface)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_CapnTunabeard:
Yarr matey! Shiver me timbers! Avast, scallywags! There's a pirate captain who once had a pet fish named Cap'n Tunabeard, but during a big storm the fishbowl fell overboard! It has a hook for a tail, and an eyepatch and everything! You need to fetch me that fish, so I can be as cool as a pirate! Obviously it's out in the ocean somewhere! Duh!

(Caught in Ocean)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Clownfish:
I saw this bright orange and colorful fish by the ocean, and it was looking around frantically as though it was seeking a lost family member! Go catch it for me, so that another one will show up looking frantically for him instead!

(Caught in Ocean)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_DemonicHellfish:
I hear in the underworld, that the King of all demons is actually a fish! Just imagine the absolute power I would have if you caught it for me!

(Caught in Caverns)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Derpfish:
Those Derplings in the jungle are the most scary creatures I've ever seen! Good thing is, sometimes they don't have legs! These ones live in the water and are a lot less scary! Catch me one now so I can see what they taste like without being scared half to death!

(Caught in Jungle Surface)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Fishron:
There's a legend of a mighty being known as the Fishron! It's part pig, part dragon, and part FISH! I hear it hangs around in the frozen subterranean lakes of the coldest part of the world! I'm not going there, so YOU go catch it and makes sure it lands in my hands! I'm so excited!

(Caught in Underground Tundra)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_InfectedScabbardfish:
A really long fish that looks like a sword's sheath swims in the murky waters of the corruption! It looks a lot like ebonstone, so don't let it fool you! That's right, you. You're catching it, not me!

(Caught in Corruption)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Mudfish:
Watch your step when wading through jungle waters! Why? No, not because I care about you being eaten by piranhas. I care because you'll step on one of my favorite kinds of fish, the Mud Fish! I also care a lot that you're going to grab me one as a pet!

(Caught in Jungle)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_TropicalBarracuda:
Piranhas and sharks are ugly! Soooo ugly! Did you know there's a fish that looks very pretty and still can eat your face off? I would pay 2 platinum to see that happen, by the way... To the point, though, you catchy for me. Just make sure I have it before you lose your face!

(Caught Jungle Surface)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_TundraTrout:
You ever wonder why the lakes on the surface of the snowy areas of {WorldName} never ice over? I don't. The fish, however, do! A fish made out of ice would make a great offering to the mighty and amazing {Angler}! Go, my loyal subject, and bring me this Tundra Trout with haste!

(Caught in Surface Tundra)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_Slimefish:
In the forest, the slimes are kinda gross. Slimefish are even more so! I don't want to swim with slimes, so yoink one out of the water for me!

(Caught in Surface Forest)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_ScarabFish:
I read this ancient story about a fish that looks like a magical scarab! That's beetle, for simpletons like you! Where do you find it? Where do you think? In the desert, duh! Don't look at me like that... it's true! There is actually water out there! I'd go, but I don't like having my eyeballs pecked out by vultures. So... you do it!

(Caught in Desert)
AnglerQuestText.Quest_ScorpioFish:
I'm sure someone, a really stupid someone, tried to tell you there was no water in the desert! They were absolutely and positively wrong! There's this thing called an Oasis, and it has water in it! Guess what happens when you have water!? That's right, you have fish! Weird fish that try to sting you and pinch you and do all kinds of other mean things to you! A perfect pet for me, and a perfect job for you!

(Caught in Desert)

PirateChatter.Chatter_1: About time we gotta barkeep around here! Me rum was almost gone!

GuideChatter.Chatter_1: I thought you said you purified {TaxCollector}? He's just as greedy as ever!
GuideChatter.Chatter_2: I wonder why my predecessor spontaneously burst into flames. Hopefully it doesn't happen to me...

NurseChatter.Chatter_1: I keep asking for wine, but all {Bartender} gives me are mugs of ale.

StylistChatter.Chatter_1: I offered {Bartender} a free trim, but he refused. I mean, I could have at least worked on his mustache!

CyborgChatter.Chatter_1: {Bartender} said I reminded him of a certain "EV2". Perhaps I should meet her.

MechanicChatter.Chatter_1: {Bartender} offered me a Root Beer, I told him to give it to me in a square cup.

AnglerChatter.Chatter_1: How come {Bartender} won't sell me any ale? I want to try some! What a grouch!
AnglerChatter.Chatter_2: Whaaaat?! Can't you see I'm winding up fishing line??
AnglerChatter.Chatter_3: I have enough fish! I don't need your help right now!
AnglerChatter.Chatter_4: There's no chefs in all of {WorldName}, so I have to cook all this fish myself!
AnglerChatter.Chatter_5: Hey! Watch it! I'm setting up traps for my biggest prank ever! No one will see it coming! Don't you dare tell anyone!
AnglerChatter.Chatter_6: Let a kid give you some advice, never touch your tongue to an ice block! Wait, forget what I said, I totally want to see you do it!
AnglerChatter.Chatter_7: Ever heard of a barking fish?! I haven't, I'm just wondering if you did!
AnglerChatter.Chatter_8: {WorldName} is filled to the brim with the most outlandish kinds of fish!
AnglerChatter.Chatter_9: I'm bummed out! There's probably been fish that have gone extinct before I even was born, and that's not fair!
AnglerChatter.Chatter_10: I don't have a mommy or a daddy, but I have a lot of fish! It's close enough!

GoblinTinkererChatter.Chatter_1: You know, these Etherian Goblins are nothing like my people. Really rowdy bunch. Not that my people are much better...

MerchantSpecialText.Party: You know what would be the best way to party? Buying things for others, specifically from me.
MerchantSpecialText.Graveyard1: This eerie atmosphere is bad for business!
MerchantSpecialText.Graveyard2: This is a terrible location... I can't sell my wares to the dead!
MerchantSpecialText.Windy1: What a blustery day! Stay awhile, and buy a thing or two.
MerchantSpecialText.Windy2: I used slime glue to keep my hat from blowing away! Perhaps I can sell you some for a couple gold coins...
MerchantSpecialText.Storm1: Wanna buy a lightning rod? Oh, seems I'm out of stock.
MerchantSpecialText.Storm2: Storms rollin' in... how 'bout you come in and buy something?
MerchantSpecialText.Rain1: Umbrellas! Umbrellas! Get your half-off umbrellas!
MerchantSpecialText.Rain2: How dreary! Lighten the mood with 99 torches!

NurseSpecialText.Party: No, I will not tell you how many candles are on my cake.
NurseSpecialText.Graveyard1: Ahh!! I'd rather be working at an abandoned hospital than hanging around here!
NurseSpecialText.Graveyard2: This place creeps me out, and I can't treat dead patients!
NurseSpecialText.Windy1: This breeze is really extra right now! Beware of flying needles.
NurseSpecialText.Windy2: I been chasing my medical instruments all day. This gale is keeping me fit!
NurseSpecialText.Storm1: I do not perform shock therapy, just go stand outside under a tree!
NurseSpecialText.Storm2: Just stay inside! I've already treated too many electrocuted patients today.
NurseSpecialText.Rain1: If you stay out there too long, you'll catch a cold!
NurseSpecialText.Rain2: Great! Now my uniform is all wet. Stop staring!

ArmsDealerSpecialText.Party: Parties are great for getting people to come out of their shell, just like with bullets.
ArmsDealerSpecialText.Graveyard1: I hate places like this. I can't kill what's already dead!
